results.corrected_us: As a Manny’s food service customer, I want to see food item types displayed in different colors so that I can quickly identify the food type visually.
results.optional_explanation: The story specifies exact color codes, which are implementation details. The core goal is to enable quick visual identification of food types, making it a focused, user-centered story.

results.corrected_us: As a reader, I want to bookmark pages so that I can easily find relevant content later.
results.optional_explanation: The story clearly states a user goal and benefit without conflating the solution or requiring further clarification.

results.corrected_us: As a Manny’s food service customer, I want to save my list so that I can print or email it for later use.
results.optional_explanation: The original story includes multiple actions (save, copy, print, email), which could be split. The core goal is saving the list for future use, so it fits under misplaced requirements (ID: 2).

results.corrected_us: As a blogger who codes, I want the blogging system to integrate with GitHub so that readers can see my GitHub activity in my profile.
results.optional_explanation: The story discusses system internals (GitHub integration) rather than end-user benefits, fitting the technical user story category (ID: 4).

results.corrected_us: As a Manny’s food service customer, I want to save, copy, print, and email my list so that I can manage and share it for various uses.
results.optional_explanation: The story combines multiple actions, which could be split, but the core goal is managing the list for different purposes, fitting ID: 2 for misplaced requirements.

results.corrected_us: As a tester, I want detailed test plans so that I can thoroughly test the system once it is completed.
results.optional_explanation: The story focuses on system internals (test plans) rather than end-user goals, fitting the technical user story category (ID: 4).

results.corrected_us: As a business user, I want a report of item profitability so that I can identify profitable items and address underperformers.
results.optional_explanation: The role is vague ('business user') but sufficiently specific for this context. The goal and value are clear, so it is a well-defined user story, but the role could be more specific.

results.corrected_us: As a system, I want to store customer account info and order lists in the database so that the system can manage customer data.
results.optional_explanation: This is a system-level story about internal data storage, which is acceptable as a user story describing system internals, but it could be more user-focused.

results.corrected_us: As a customer, I want to locate my previous food order lists so that I can view all my past orders.
results.optional_explanation: The goal is user-facing and clear; no conflation or technical details present. It is well-defined.

results.corrected_us: As a Manny’s food service customer, I want my custom item code to stand out so that I can find it more quickly on the screen.

results.corrected_us: As a blogger who codes, I want my GitHub activity displayed in my profile so that readers can see my coding activity.

results.corrected_us: As a Manny’s food service customer, I want to save my list so that I can reorder from it later for more accurate food orders.
results.optional_explanation: The story involves saving the list for reordering, which is a user benefit. It could be split into multiple stories but is primarily about list reuse, fitting ID: 2.
